file.name: swagger.yaml
file.content:
--- openapi: 3.0.3 info: title: WhatsOpt API version: v1 contact: name: API Support email: remi.lafage@onera.fr license: name: Apache 2.0 url: https://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html servers: - url: https://ether.onera.fr/whatsopt description: External production server - url: https://selene.onecert.fr/whatsopt description: Internal production server - url: https://erebe.onecert.fr/whatsopt description: Internal staging server - url: http://persephone:3000 description: Development server - url: http://localhost:3000 description: Docker development server paths: "/api/v1/analyses": get: summary: Get analyses tags: - Multi-Disciplinary Analyses security: - Token: [] responses: '200': description: List analyses content: application/json: schema: type: array items: type: object properties: id: type: integer name: type: string created_at: type: string format: date-time updated_at: type: string format: date-time required: - id - name - created_at - updated_at "/api/v1/analyses/{id}": get: summary: Get analysis details tags: - Multi-Disciplinary Analyses security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: Analysis identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '200': description: return analysis information content: application/json: schema: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/AnalysisInfo" "/api/v1/analyses/{id}.xdsm": get: summary: Get XDSMjs format for given analysis tags: - Multi-Disciplinary Analyses security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: Analysis identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '200': description: return XDSM structure content: application/json: schema: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Xdsm" "/api/v1/meta_models": get: summary: Get meta-models tags: - Meta-Modeling security: - Token: [] responses: '200': description: List meta-models content: application/json: schema: type: array items: type: object properties: id: type: integer reference_analysis: "$ref": "#components/schemas/AnalysisInfo" required: - id - reference_analysis "/api/v1/meta_models/{id}": get: summary: Get meta-model details tags: - Meta-Modeling security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: Meta-model identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '200': description: return meta-model information content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: id: type: integer reference_analysis: "$ref": "#components/schemas/AnalysisInfo" surrogate_kind: type: string enum: - SMT_KRIGING - SMT_KPLS - SMT_KPLSK - SMT_LS - SMT_QP - OPENTURNS_PCE xlabels: type: array items: type: string ylabels: type: array items: type: string put: summary: Predict using the meta-model description: Compute y responses at given x points tags: - Meta-Modeling security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: MetaModel identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '200': description: y predictions at x points in matrix format (nsample, nydim) content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: y: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Matrix" '404': description: MetaModel not found content: application/json: schema: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Error" requestBody: description: 'x points where to predict using matrix format (nsampling, nxdim)
where nsampling is the number of points and nxdim the dimension of x
Each column corresponds to the various values of an input variables of the metamodel.
For one sampling point x (x_1, x_2, ..., x_nxdim), x_* values consist of input variables listed in *lexical order*
When a variable is multidimensional it should be expanded as variable''s size scalar values
(example: z of shape (m, p, q) will expands in ''z[0]'', ''z[1]'', ..., ''z[m*p*q-1]'', ''z[m*p*q]'' scalar values).' required: true content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: meta_model: type: object properties: x: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Matrix" "/api/v1/optimizations": post: summary: Create an optimization context description: Initialize optimization context specifying design space and constraints.
Mixed-integer multi-objectives optimization is available (SEGMOOMOE), it supersedes legacy mono-objective continuous optimization which is still available (SEGOMOE). tags: - Optimization security: - Token: [] parameters: [] responses: '201': description: Optimization successfully created content: {} requestBody: description: Optmization context: xlimits and optional constraints
- kind: Optimizer name either 'SEGOMOE' (continous mono-objective) or 'SEGMOOMOE'(mixed-integer multi-objectives)
- n_obj: Number of objectives > 0 (used only with 'SEGMOOMOE')
- xlimits: design space in matrix format (nxdim, 2). The ith row is [lower bound, upper bound] of the ith design variable.
- cstr_specs: constraint c specification either *cbound*, *c=bound* (default is *<0*)
- options of the given optimizer (SEGOMOE or SEGMOOMOE) require: true content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: optimization: type: object properties: kind: type: string description: Optimizer name enum: - SEGOMOE - SEGMOOMOE n_obj: type: integer description: Number of objectives > 0 (used only by multi-obj optimization aka SEGMOOMOE) xtypes: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/XTypes" xlimits: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/XLimits" cstr_specs: type: array items: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/ConstraintSpec" options: type: object description: options of SEGOMOE or SEGOMOOE optimizers (cf. opimizers doc) required: - xlimits required: - optimization "/api/v1/optimizations/{id}": put: summary: Ask for next optimal x suggestion where f(x suggestion) is expected to be minimal description: Compute next x sample point suggestion regarding provided x, y which result of previous function f evaluations
and optional constraint functions g1, g2, ..., gn specified at optimization creation.
Previous evaluations should result from an initial DOE execution followed by previous call evaluation on previous suggestions. When with_best is set, the best result (aka best locations and values of optimum) is also returned as x_best and y_best. In case of mono-obj x and y are matrices with one row, in case of multi-obj it is a Pareto front with several rows. tags: - Optimization security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: Optimization identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '204': description: x suggestion computation started content: {} requestBody: description: 'x, y sampling points using matrix format (nsample, nxdim), (nsampling, nydim)
where nsampling is the number of sample points, nxdim the dimension of x and
nydim the dimension of y.
Each column of x corresponds to the various values of an *input variables* of the optimized function.
Each column of y corresponds to the various values of an *output variables* of the optimized function.
y sampling result from the concatenation of the objective function f scalar result (required) and optional
contraint functions g1, g2, etc evaluated at a given sampling point x.
For one sampling point x (x_1, x_2, ..., x_nxdim), x_* values consist of input variables listed in *lexical order*
For one sampling result y (y_1, y_2, ..., y_nydim), x_* values consist of output variables listed in *lexical order*
When a variable is multidimensional it should be expanded as variable''s size scalar values
(example: z of shape (m, p, q) will expands in ''z[0]'', ''z[1]'', ..., ''z[m*p*q-1]'', ''z[m*p*q]'' scalar values).' required: true content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: optimization: type: object properties: x: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Matrix" y: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Matrix" with_best: description: whether x_best, y_best are computed type: boolean get: summary: Retrieve optimization result tags: - Optimization security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: Optimization identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '200': description: Retrieve current optimization result (x_best and y_best available only if with_best set on put request) content: application/json: schema: type: object description: Optimization result properties: x_suggested: "$ref": "#components/schemas/RowVector" nullable: true status: type: integer enum: - -1 - 0 - 1 - 2 - 3 - 4 x_best: description: best optimum location (mono-obj) or best optima locations (multi-obj) so far "$ref": "#components/schemas/Matrix" nullable: true y_best: description: best optimum value (mono-obj) or best optima values (multi-obj) so far "$ref": "#components/schemas/Matrix" nullable: true required: - x_suggested - status delete: summary: Destroy optimization context tags: - Optimization security: - Token: [] parameters: - name: id in: path description: Optimization identifier required: true schema: type: string responses: '204': description: Optimization context successfully deleted content: {} components: schemas: AnalysisInfo: type: object properties: id: type: integer name: type: string created_at: type: string format: date-time updated_at: type: string format: date-time owner_email: type: string format: email notes: type: string AnalysisAttributes: type: object properties: name: type: string disciplines_attributes: type: array items: type: object properties: name: type: string variables_attributes: type: array items: type: object properties: name: type: string io_mode: type: string enum: - in - out sub_analysis_attributes: "$ref": "#/components/schemas/AnalysisAttributes" ConstraintSpec: type: object properties: type: type: string enum: - "<" - ">" - "=" default: "<" bound: type: number format: double default: 0.0 Error: type: object properties: message: type: string Interval: type: array items: type: number format: double minItems: 2 maxItems: 2 Matrix: description: list of row vectors type: array items: "$ref": "#components/schemas/RowVector" minItems: 1 RowVector: type: array items: type: number format: double minItems: 1 XLimits: description: design space (nxdim intervals) type: array items: "$ref": "#components/schemas/Interval" minItems: 1 Xdsm: type: object additionalProperties: type: object properties: nodes: type: array items: type: object properties: id: type: string name: type: string type: type: string edges: type: array items: type: object properties: from: type: string to: type: string name: type: string XTypes: description: design space type: array items: "$ref": "#components/schemas/XType" minItems: 1 XType: type: object properties: type: type: string enum: - "FLOAT" - "INT" - "ORD" - "ENUM" limits: type: array description: depending on type a couple of floats, a couple of integers, a list of integers, a list of strings items: type: number securitySchemes: Token: type: apiKey in: header name: Authorization description: Enter your API key with the format **Token <API key>** security: - Token: [] tags: - name: Multi-Disciplinary Analyses description: Operations for using analyses created in WhatsOpt - name: Meta-Modeling description: Operations for using meta-models created in WhatsOpt - name: Optimization description: Operations for using Onera mono-obj continuous optimizer (SEGOMOE) or Onera multi-obj mixed-integer optimizer (SEGMOOMOE) externalDocs: description: Find out more on WhatsOpt url: http://github.com/OneraHub/WhatsOpt

Error: parse: parse spec: parse components: schemas: "Matrix": parse schema: parse schema: at 1:1131: find schema: resolve: invalid pointer "components/schemas/RowVector": pointer must start with '/'
